Test Name: Culture referred for identification of Mycobacterium and Nocardia with antimicrobial susceptibility testing
Specimen Type: Sputum, bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL), tissue biopsies, sterile body fluids (e.g., cerebrospinal fluid)
Purpose: To accurately identify Mycobacterium and Nocardia isolates and determine their antimicrobial susceptibility to guide appropriate clinical management.
Equipment: Biosafety cabinet, incubator (35–37 °C), microscope for acid-fast staining, automated identification/susceptibility system (e.g., VITEK 2 or microplate reader)
